Article Title: Watch: LPG tanker detaches, leaks on Coimbatore's Avinashi road flyover, alert sounded
Article Text:
Gas leak chaos on Coimbatore flyover

COIMBATORE: An LPG tanker detached from a truck on Avinashi Road flyover in the early hours of Friday. The Coimbatore city police closed the traffic on the flyover and underpass. The fire and rescue services personnel sprayed water on the tanker as gas leakage was noticed from the LPG tanker.The tanker, carrying 18 tonnes of LPG, was en route from Kochi, Kerala, to an LPG bottling plant owned by Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) in Ganapathy, Coimbatore.The truck was travelling on the Avinashi Road flyover when the tanker detached from the trailer of the truck due to a turn plate pin damage around 3am on Friday.The tanker fell on the Avinashi Road flyover, and gas leakage was also noticed from the tanker. The tanker truck driver alerted the fire and rescue services personnel, who rushed to the spot.Meanwhile, the Coimbatore city police also reached the spot and blocked vehicle movements on the flyover and underpass. Barricades were placed to stop vehicle movements, and the traffic was diverted.The fire and rescue services personnel sprayed water on the tanker truck. Technical experts and officials from BPCL visited the spot, and the technical experts attempted to arrest the LPG leakage.A crane was also brought to the spot to lift the LPG tanker. The officials planned to transfer the LPG to other trucks from the damaged tanker. Meanwhile, Coimbatore city police commissioner A Saravana Sundar visited the spot and discussed with the BPCL officials.Coimbatore district Collector Kranthi Kumar Pati visited the site and met with oil corporation officials. He confirmed that the gas leak from the tanker had been completely controlled.As a precautionary measure, around 37 schools located at least 500 meters to one kilometer from the Avinashi Road flyover were declared closed for the day.The district collector also stated that the tanker would be safely removed from the flyover within three hours.
Article Summary: tanker was en route from Kochi, Kerala, to an LPG bottling plant in Ganapathy, Coimbatore. Truck was travelling on the Avinashi Road flyover when the tanker detached from the trailer of the truck due to a turn plate pin damage around 3am on Friday.

Article Title: Delhi assembly polls: Congress fields Alka Lamba against CM Atishi from Kalkaji constituency
Article Text:
Atishi and Alka Lamba (R)

NEW DELHI: The Congress party on Friday announced Alka Lamba as its candidate for the Kalkaji constituency in the upcoming Delhi assembly elections. Lamba, a former AAP member, will take on incumbent Delhi chief minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Atishi in what promises to be a high-stakes battle.In a press release, the All India Congress Committee (AICC) said, “The Central Election Committee has approved the candidature of Ms. Alka Lamba as the Congress candidate to contest the forthcoming general election to the Legislative Assembly of Delhi from 51 - Kalkaji constituency.”"I don’t think I am contesting against the CM. Arvind Kejriwal himself called Atishi a 'temporary CM,' so she has only a month left. Kejriwal won't return anyway. As a woman holding a constitutional post, she is disrespecting her position. Atishi must clarify her stance on being called a 'temporary CM' by Kejriwal," said Congress leader Alka Lamba after being declared as Kalkaji candidate.In the 2020 Delhi elections, Atishi had won the Kalkaji seat with over 55,000 votes, defeating BJP’s Dharambir. Meanwhile, Congress’ Shivani Chopra secured less than 5,000 votes, finishing third in the contest.
Article Summary: Alka Lamba, a former AAP member, will take on incumbent Delhi chief minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Atishi. In the 2020 Delhi elections, Atishi had won the Kalkaji seat with over 55,000 votes, defeating BJP’s Dharambir.

Article Title: Congress to join SC case defending Places of Worship Act
Article Text: NEW DELHI: After accusing BJP govt of "brazenly violating" the Places of Worship Act , 1991, Congress is set to join the case in Supreme Court by demanding that the 1991 law be adhered to strictly.Supreme Court on December 12 ordered a stay on surveys ordered by various courts on pleas claiming that there were temples beneath Muslim religious structures. These have been contested by various bodies and individuals, in response to which the apex court ordered the stay. Congress MP and lawyer Abhishek Manu Singhvi is appearing in these cases.Sources said Congress will soon file an application, which is largely symbolic because the case is already in progress. It is still to be decided if the case will be filed in the name of the party or a senior office-bearer like AICC general secretary K C Venugopal will sign the application.However, it will highlight the political stance of the party in view of the "chaos" wrought by recent developments. In the CWC meeting on Nov 29, party functionaries had slammed the "violation" of Places of Worship Act while accusing BJP of orchestrating applications in courts to keep polarisation on a boil. CWC also passed a resolution attacking BJP and the Modi govt on the issue.Sources said after SC stay order, key Congress functionaries held a meeting with the brass, which included party chief Mallikarjun Kharge and LoP in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi, where various aspects of the issue were discussed. A decision to implead in the case was also taken in the huddle.During the recent Parliament session, there was also talk about the opposition INDIA bloc filing the case together, but now the parties seem to be going ahead individually. Also, Samajwadi Party made the police firing in UP's Sambhal, where a survey of a mosque has been ordered, a key issue of protest in the Parliament.
Article Summary: Supreme Court on December 12 ordered a stay on surveys ordered by various courts on pleas claiming that there were temples beneath Muslim religious structures. These have been contested by various bodies and individuals. Congress MP and lawyer Abhishek Manu Singhvi is appearing in these cases.

Article Title: Life term for 10 accused in 2019 Kerala double murder case
Article Text: KOCHI/KASARAGOD: A CBI court on Friday sentenced 10 accused to life imprisonment and four others, including former CPM MLA from Uduma KV Kunhiraman, to five years in jail for the murder of two Youth Congress workers at Periya in Kerala's Kasaragod in February 2019. The court had found them guilty on Saturday.The 10 accused were given life imprisonment under two counts of murder and criminal conspiracy. A fine of Rs 2 lakh each has also been imposed on them. The case pertains to the murder of Youth Congress at Periya on Feb 17, 2019 while returning home on a motorbike. They were assaulted by a hit team with weapons."This case reflects and represents the bizarre offshoot of political vandalism culminating in the premature death of two vibrant youths," the judge said. In Kasaragod, emotions ran high at the memorial of two victims as the court pronounced the verdict. Parents and relatives broke into tears, expressing dissatisfaction over the quantum of punishment. They said they expected death penalty for the convicts.
Article Summary: A CBI court on Friday sentenced 10 accused to life imprisonment and four others to five years in jail. The 10 accused were given life imprisonment under two counts of murder and criminal conspiracy. The case pertains to the murder of Youth Congress at Periya on Feb 17, 2019 while returning home on a motorbike.

Article Title: Allahabad HC stays arrest of SP MP in Sambhal violence case
Article Text: PRAYAGRAJ: The Allahabad high court on Friday stayed the arrest of Samajwadi Party MP Ziaur Rahman Barq in connection with the violence in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district during a survey of the Mughal-era Shahi Jama Masjid .The HC, however, refused to quash the FIR registered in the case. A bench of justices Rajiv Gupta and Azahar Husain Idrisi told the MP to cooperate with the investigators. The bench said that the prayer made in the petition cannot be entertained and as such, "no interference is warranted", as of now. However, considering the fact that all the offences mentioned in the FIR are punishable with a jail term up to 7 years, the court said in case Barq is arrested in the case, the authorities shall ensure that the specific provisions contained in section 35 of Bharatiya Nagrik Suraksha Sanhita and the guidelines related to arrests issued by the Supreme Court in the case of Arnesh Kumar Vs. State of Bihar are followed.
Article Summary: Allahabad high court stays arrest of Samajwadi Party MP Ziaur Rahman Barq in connection with violence in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district. The HC, however, refused to quash the FIR registered in the case. A bench of justices Rajiv Gupta and Azahar Husain Idrisi told the MP to cooperate with the investigators.

Article Title: Laws valid in a state hold in one carved out of it: SC
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Supreme Court said all laws applicable in a state would also be valid in a new state carved out of it unless the law is altered or amended by the new state.A bench of Justice C T Ravikumar and Rajesh Bindal also said that state govt permission was not needed for Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to probe and register a case against a central govt employee working in a state.It passed the order while adjudicating a dispute over whether Telangana state's approval was needed for CBI probe after it was carved out of Andhra Pradesh.Court said that Andra Pradesh had approved application of Delhi Special Police Establishment Act in the state in 1990 and it would be applicable in Telangana also till the new state withdrew its consent.The bench referred to earlier ruling of the apex court in which it was held that the laws which were applicable to the undivided State of Bihar would continue to apply to the new states created by the Act and that the laws that operated would continue to operate notwithstanding the bifurcation of the erstwhile State of Bihar and creation of the new State of Jharkhand and they would continue in force until and unless altered, repealed or amended, it was further held.
Article Summary: All laws applicable in a state would also be valid in a new state carved out of it unless the law is altered or amended by the new state. A bench of Justice C T Ravikumar and Rajesh Bindal also said that state govt permission was not needed for Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to probe and register a case.

Article Text: JAMMU: Alert Army troops averted a mishap by detecting an Improvised Explosive Device in J&K’s Reasi district late Thursday. The explosive was later neutralised.Under Operation Adbes, Rashtriya Rifles personnel found the IED in the forest area of Mahore’s Angralla-Bhalla in the evening, Army’s White Knight Corps posted on X.The area was secured with assistance from J&K Police and the IED was defused by the bomb disposal squad , it stated in another post.
Article Summary: Rashtriya Rifles personnel found the IED in the forest area of Mahore’s Angralla-Bhalla in the evening. The area was secured with assistance from J&K Police. The IED was defused by the bomb disposal squad.

Article Title: Jammu BJYM leader shot over parking feud; hospitalised
Article Text: JAMMU: Advocate Kanav Sharma, president of Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha’s Jammu wing and son of senior BJP member Chander Mohan Sharma, was injured after being shot by an electricity department employee following a parking feud in Roop Nagar area Friday, police said.“Around 2.15pm, a scuffle broke out between Sharma, a resident of Roop Nagar’s New Plot area, and Harvinder Singh alias Kaka over parking opposite a transformer station. As the argument escalated, Singh, a power department employee (meter reader) fired two shots at Sharma. One of the bullets hit Sharma in the abdomen while the other missed,” said a police source.“An injured Sharma was rushed to Sarwal govt hospital, from where he was referred to Jammu GMC. His condition is stated to be stable,” the source added.SP Jammu (North) Vivek Shekhar said a case had been registered and further probe was underway to determine the motive behind the attack.
Article Summary: Advocate Kanav Sharma, president of Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha’s Jammu wing and son of senior BJP member Chander Mohan Sharma, was injured. He was shot by an electricity department employee following a parking feud in Roop Nagar area Friday, police said.

Article Title: BJP: Congress has a myopic view of Indian history, centered around Jawaharlal Nehru
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Slamming Congress for criticising the Modi govt over a Delhi University college being named after RSS ideologue Veer Savarkar, BJP on Friday said Congress has a myopic view of Indian history, centered only around Jawaharlal Nehru."They ignore leaders like Subhas Chandra Bose, Sardar Patel, and spread misinformation about Savarkar," senior BJP member Rajeev Chandrasekhar said at a press conference.He asked Congress to stop reading the Nehru-Gandhi family's history book and learn the country's "true history" from a book that has chapters on leaders such as Sardar Patel, V D Savarkar, Bose and Syama Prasad Mookerjee.Congress, during its rule, named "thousands of" educational institutions in the country after former PMs Nehru, Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi, he said. "If Congress is so interested, it can give us suggestions and we will change the names of two-three institutions" them, Chandrasekhar said on a day the DU college's foundation stone was laid by PM Narendra Modi.He said, "If it gives suggestions, we will definitely reach out to the govt to rename two-three institutions after (former PMs) P V Narasimha Rao and Manmohan Singh." Congress's students' wing NSUI on Thursday had demanded that the college be named after Singh who passed away recently.On Congress member Naseer Hussain's allegation on Thursday that BJP was glorifying "mercy-petition writers" by naming colleges after them, while disregarding the contribution of freedom fighters, Chandrasekhar said, "People from Congress must change their history book, in which there are only four chapters, with the first three on Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi, and the last chapter on Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi."
Article Summary: BJP slams Congress for criticising the Modi govt over a Delhi University college being named after RSS ideologue Veer Savarkar. Congress, during its rule, named "thousands of" educational institutions in the country after former PMs Nehru, Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi.
